concise_definition: v. 竞赛, 奔跑, 急速移动

definitions.explanation_en: To move or travel at high speed, often in a competitive context or with urgency.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以高速移动，通常用于竞赛语境或表示紧迫感。
definitions.example_en: The runners raced toward the finish line as the crowd cheered.
definitions.example_cn: 运动员们冲向终点线，观众们欢呼喝彩。

definitions.explanation_en: To compete in a contest of speed, typically involving physical movement such as running, swimming, or driving.
definitions.explanation_cn: 参加速度竞赛，通常涉及跑步、游泳或驾驶等身体运动。
definitions.example_en: She raced in the marathon last weekend and won first place.
definitions.example_cn: 她上周末参加了马拉松比赛并获得第一名。

definitions.explanation_en: To pass or go by quickly, often implying a sense of time slipping away.
definitions.explanation_cn: 迅速经过或流逝，常暗示时间飞逝。
definitions.example_en: The years raced by as she focused on her career.
definitions.example_cn: 她专注于事业时，岁月飞逝。

comparison.analysis: “Run” (跑) 是更通用的词，泛指用双腿快速移动，不必然包含竞争或速度极限的含义。而 “raced” 强调在竞争、对抗或紧迫感驱动下的高速运动，隐含目标导向和激烈性。
“Sprinted” (短跑冲刺) 是 “race” 的一种具体形式，特指短距离、爆发性的全力奔跑。而 “raced” 可用于长距离、多种运动形式（如赛车、赛船），范围更广，不局限于短时爆发。
“Hurried” (匆忙) 强调因紧迫而加快动作，但不一定涉及高速或竞技性，可能只是行为急促。而 “raced” 更强调物理速度和动力，常带有视觉上的动态感和能量感。
